zea mays.gloss: tall annual cereal grass bearing kernels on large ears: widely cultivated in America in many varieties

zea mays amylacea.gloss: corn having kernels almost entirely of soft starch

zea mays everta.gloss: corn having small ears and kernels that burst when exposed to dry heat

zea mays indentata.gloss: corn whose kernels contain both hard and soft starch and become indented at maturity

zea mays indurata.gloss: corn having kernels with a hard outer layer enclosing the soft endosperm

zea mays rugosa.gloss: a corn plant developed in order to have young ears that are sweet and suitable for eating

zea saccharata.gloss: a corn plant developed in order to have young ears that are sweet and suitable for eating

zeal.gloss: a feeling of strong eagerness (usually in favor of a person or cause)

zealand.gloss: the largest island of Denmark and the site of Copenhagen

zealot.gloss: a fervent and even militant proponent of something

zebibit.gloss: a unit of information equal to 1024 exbibits or 2^70 bits

zebibyte.gloss: a unit of information equal to 1024 exbibytes or 2^70 bytes

zebra-tailed lizard.gloss: swift lizard with long black-banded tail and long legs

zebra crossing.gloss: street crossing where pedestrians have right of way

zebra finch.gloss: small Australian weaverbird with markings like a zebra's

zebra mussel.gloss: inch long mollusk imported accidentally from Europe

zebra orchid.gloss: orchid with reddish linear leaves and panicle of purple-marked pale-yellow flowers with deep red or purple lip

zebrawood.gloss: any of various trees or shrubs having mottled or striped wood

zebrawood family.gloss: mostly tropical climbing shrubs or small trees

zebrawood tree.gloss: any of various trees or shrubs having mottled or striped wood

zechariah.gloss: a Hebrew minor prophet of the late 6th century BC
an Old Testament book telling the prophecies of Zechariah which are concerned mainly with the renewal of Israel after the Babylonian Captivity

zed.gloss: the 26th letter of the Roman alphabet

zee.gloss: the 26th letter of the Roman alphabet

zeeman.gloss: Dutch physicist honored for his research on the influence of magnetism on radiation which showed that light is radiated by the motion of charged particles in an atom (1865-1943)

zeidae.gloss: a family of fish in the order Zeomorphi

zellig harris.gloss: United States linguist (born in Ukraine) who developed mathematical linguistics and interpreted speech and writing in a social context (1909-1992)

zellig sabbatai harris.gloss: United States linguist (born in Ukraine) who developed mathematical linguistics and interpreted speech and writing in a social context (1909-1992)

zen.gloss: school of Mahayana Buddhism asserting that enlightenment can come through meditation and intuition rather than faith
street name for lysergic acid diethylamide

synonyms.word: lucy in the sky with diamonds

zen buddhism.gloss: school of Mahayana Buddhism asserting that enlightenment can come through meditation and intuition rather than faith

zenaidura macroura.gloss: wild dove of the United States having a mournful call

zend-avesta.gloss: a collection of Zoroastrian texts gathered during the 4th or 6th centuries

zeno.gloss: ancient Greek philosopher who formulated paradoxes that defended the belief that motion and change are illusory (circa 495-430 BC)
ancient Greek philosopher who founded the Stoic school (circa 335-263 BC)

zeno of citium.gloss: ancient Greek philosopher who founded the Stoic school (circa 335-263 BC)

zeno of elea.gloss: ancient Greek philosopher who formulated paradoxes that defended the belief that motion and change are illusory (circa 495-430 BC)

zep.gloss: a large sandwich made of a long crusty roll split lengthwise and filled with meats and cheese (and tomato and onion and lettuce and condiments)

zephaniah.gloss: a Hebrew minor prophet of the late 7th century BC
an Old Testament book telling the prophecies of Zephaniah which are concerned mainly with the approaching judgment by God upon the sinners of Judah

zeppelin.gloss: German inventor who designed and built the first rigid motorized dirigible (1838-1917)
a large rigid dirigible designed to carry passengers or bombs

zero.gloss: indicating the absence of any or all units under consideration
having no measurable or otherwise determinable value

zero-coupon bond.gloss: a bond that is issued at a deep discount from its value at maturity and pays no interest during the life of the bond

zero-coupon security.gloss: a security that makes no interest payments but instead is sold at a deep discount from its face value

zero coupon bond.gloss: a bond that is issued at a deep discount from its value at maturity and pays no interest during the life of the bond

zero coupon security.gloss: a security that makes no interest payments but instead is sold at a deep discount from its face value

zero point.gloss: the point on a scale from which positive or negative numerical quantities can be measured

zestril.gloss: an ACE inhibiting drug (trade names Prinival or Zestril) administered as an antihypertensive and after heart attacks

zetland.gloss: an archipelago of about 100 islands in the North Atlantic off the north coast of Scotland

zettabit.gloss: a unit of information equal to 1000 exabits or 10^21 bits

zettabyte.gloss: a unit of information equal to 1000 exabytes or 10^21 bytes
a unit of information equal to 1024 exbibytes or 2^70 bytes

zeus.gloss: type genus of the family Zeidae

zero in.gloss: direct onto a point or target, especially by automatic navigational aids
adjust (as by firing under test conditions) the zero of (a gun)

zealous.gloss: marked by active interest and enthusiasm
